name: For Charity
description: At a Starfleet charity costume gala, dignitaries arrive for a nice evening. Quark, dressed as a Klingon, falls to the floor! Doctor Bashir carries him to a quiet room for treatment, as Riker asks your help to secure the gala without disrupting it.
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of W. Riker, Bashir, or Quark will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Riker, Bashir, or Quark
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: Spock
featured_crew.flavor: Spock is made a telekinetic plaything after failing to appeal to the Platoniansâ€™ sense of logic.

action.name: Take Care, Young Ladies, And Value Your Wine...

featured_crew.name: Quark
featured_crew.flavor: After a Klingon dies in Quark's bar, his widow Grilka takes Quark to Qo'noS.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Riker
rewards.flavor: When off-duty, Commander Riker often held poker nights for his fellow bridge officers.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Quark
rewards.flavor: After a Klingon dies in Quark's bar, his widow Grilka takes Quark to Qo'noS.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Help the Federation maintain order and secure the event.
Help the Ferengi Traditionalists save the other Ferengi.
Help the Ferengi Alliance cover up the disturbance.

screens.text: "Commander Riker, I wish I were seeing you under better circumstances. Quark just collapsed, and I've removed him to a private area. My initial examination of him suggests he's been poisoned. We've got to evacuate this event immediately."
"Ruin the Federation's top charity event of the year? No way. We can work around this without shutting the event down, I'm sure of it. Doctor Bashir, what does Quark need?"

"I need to learn more about this poison to synthesize an antidote. The best I can do in the meantime is keep Quark comfortable and out of pain... But Commander... Time is not on our side. I didn't think I'd need to bring medical supplies to a charity ball, but here we are."
"Understood. Captain, I'll do an initial security sweep of the hall, while you help Doctor Bashir obtain whatever equipment he needs to help Quark. We don't have much time."

"Commander Riker, I wish I were seeing you under better circumstances. Quark just collapsed, and I've removed him to a private area. My initial examination of him suggests he's been poisoned. We've got to evacuate this event immediately."
"Ruin the Federation's top charity event of the year? No way. We can work around this without shutting the event down, I'm sure of it. Doctor Bashir, what does Quark need?"

"I need to learn more about this poison to synthesize an antidote. The best I can do in the meantime is keep Quark comfortable and out of pain... But Commander... Time is not on our side. I didn't think I'd need to bring medical supplies to a charity ball, but here we are."
"Understood. Captain, I'll do an initial security sweep of the hall, while you help Doctor Bashir obtain whatever equipment he needs to help Quark. We don't have much time."

responses.text: "What have you learned about the poison?"
"Do we know which food is poisoned?"
"Who would poison Quark? At a charity ball?"

screens.text: "Captain, you delivered everything I needed, and right on time, too. I've stabilized Quark, but I still need to formulate an antidote."

"It's a compound that only affects Ferengi. The good news is, only a few guests at the gala are in danger. The bad news is, all of the Ferengi here are at risk. At the very least, you'll need to replace the toasted tubeworm and the flaked blood flea from the buffet."

"That, and uncovering who's responsible. Quark here is a Ferengi Traditionalist, so it could be other Ferengi from the Ferengi Alliance, or someone who just hates Ferengi. It's almost got to be politically motivated, since there's no profit to be had tonight."
"Again, it's key that we downplay the incident so that the party can continue on without anyone suspecting a problem. Doctor Bashir, keep up the good work. Captain, you're with me."

"Quark ate the toasted tubeworm and the flaked blood flea from the buffet, but that might not be all that's poisoned. I'd start with replacing foods specifically intended for Ferengi. The compound affecting him is only poison to Ferengi. It's they who are in danger."

"That's helpful. Good work, Doctor. What we also need to uncover here -- again, without disrupting the party -- is who did this. There's no profit to be had at a charity gala, so the motivation is likely political."

"Quark is a Ferengi Traditionalist, so it could be Ferengi Alliance. Regardless, Commander Riker, Captain... You'll need to hurry. My treatment has slowed the poison down, but Quark still needs an antidote. Good luck to you both."
"That's an important question. There's no profit to be had here at this event, so we're probably looking at something politically motivated."

"Commander, I concur. Quark ate the toasted tubeworm and the flaked blood flea from the buffet, and the poison is one that only affects Ferengi. They may or may not have been after Quark specifically, but Ferengi guests are at risk. So is Quark, still, until I have the antidote."

"Understood. Captain, we need to replace the food, and find out who is responsible. Quark is a Ferengi Traditionalist, so we may be looking at an act by the Ferengi Alliance. Let's start there. Remember... It's important that the party continue undisturbed!"

responses.text: "What have you learned about the poison?"
"Do we know which food is poisoned?"
"Who would poison Quark? At a charity ball?"

screens.text: "Captain, you delivered everything I needed, and right on time, too. I've stabilized Quark, but I still need to formulate an antidote."

"It's a compound that only affects Ferengi. The good news is, only a few guests at the gala are in danger. The bad news is, all of the Ferengi here are at risk. At the very least, you'll need to replace the toasted tubeworm and the flaked blood flea from the buffet."

"That, and uncovering who's responsible. Quark here is a Ferengi Traditionalist, so it could be other Ferengi from the Ferengi Alliance, or someone who just hates Ferengi. It's almost got to be politically motivated, since there's no profit to be had tonight."
"Again, it's key that we downplay the incident so that the party can continue on without anyone suspecting a problem. Doctor Bashir, keep up the good work. Captain, you're with me."

"Quark ate the toasted tubeworm and the flaked blood flea from the buffet, but that might not be all that's poisoned. I'd start with replacing foods specifically intended for Ferengi. The compound affecting him is only poison to Ferengi. It's they who are in danger."

"That's helpful. Good work, Doctor. What we also need to uncover here -- again, without disrupting the party -- is who did this. There's no profit to be had at a charity gala, so the motivation is likely political."

"Quark is a Ferengi Traditionalist, so it could be Ferengi Alliance. Regardless, Commander Riker, Captain... You'll need to hurry. My treatment has slowed the poison down, but Quark still needs an antidote. Good luck to you both."
"That's an important question. There's no profit to be had here at this event, so we're probably looking at something politically motivated."

"Commander, I concur. Quark ate the toasted tubeworm and the flaked blood flea from the buffet, and the poison is one that only affects Ferengi. They may or may not have been after Quark specifically, but Ferengi guests are at risk. So is Quark, still, until I have the antidote."

"Understood. Captain, we need to replace the food, and find out who is responsible. Quark is a Ferengi Traditionalist, so we may be looking at an act by the Ferengi Alliance. Let's start there. Remember... It's important that the party continue undisturbed!"
